entry.title: on S/4HANA, if I use ADT to create custom CDS views, is it keeping the core clean?
entry.content:
Using ADT, if I were to create custom CDS views in S/4HANA on PCE or in S/4HANA on premise so I can create custom data products in SAP BDC, am I still keeping the core clean?   

Thanks.

Regards,

Mel Calucin

entry.title: How to connect and replicate custom tables from SAP BTP to SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Could you please suggest the best approach to connect and replicate the custom tables data from SAP BTP to SAP Datasphere.

  • Details are below: 
    - Multiple custom tables are built on SAP BTP ABAP
    - Integration or which connection type between SAP BTP ABAP and SAP Datasphere is preferred or best
    - What are the supported Data replication Methods (real time or batch)

Use case: Reporting need
SAP BTP ABAP - Custom tables --> SAP Datasphere --> SAP SAC - Reporting

Kindly provide the inputs. Thank you.
--
BR, KRPK

SAP Datasphere SAP BTP ABAP environment

entry.title: Retrieve data from SAP datasphere using OData API (for system integration)
entry.content:
Hi,

I am trying to retrieve data from SAP datasphere using its OData API. My usecase is "I have an application ABC who wants to retrieve data from SAP data sphere views/models using OData API capability."

I am using postman for my POC/testing purpose. I have read through the below blog How to setup Postman for consuming SAP DATASPHERE ... - SAP Community and is successfully able to retrieve data by creating OAuth2 client for "Interactive Usage" purpose. But my issue with this approach is this token is able to access data from any OData API from any space. I want to restrict access to specific space only.

So I thought may be I should use "Technical User" while creating OAUth client. I have also created a scoped role, given access to required space and added this role to oauth client while creating it.

In postman, I used grant type as client credentials, used oauth2SAML token url of datasphere in !Access Token URL" below,  entered ID & secret and generated a toke, it was successful. But using this token as well I am able to retrieve data from any space. Looks like the scoped role didn't work. 

Can you please help me where I have gone wrong? is it even right way to do it when an application wants to integrate with DSP?

SAP Datasphere OData 

@Matthew_Shaw 

@Ian_Henry  @RichT @shubham521 

 

Thanks in advance.

Regards

Sandy

entry.title: ODP Extractors from S/4 HANA Not Visible in Datasphere Replication Flow (Valid ABAP Connection)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are facing an issue while setting up replication flows in SAP Datasphere.
Although the ABAP connection to our S/4HANA system is successful and valid, the ODP extractors are not appearing in Datasphere replication flow

Issue:

  • In Datasphere → Replication Flow → when selecting Source Objects, ODP extractors are not listed.

  • Verified that standard extractors (e.g., 2LIS*) exist in source system and extraction enabled.

  • Connection test in datasphere shows no errors - replication flow enabled.

 

Kindly help to resolve the issue

entry.title: SAP BDC Trial System takes long time for setup
entry.content:
Am trying to get hands on with SAP BDC trial system SAP Business Data Cloud . When I registered for the same,  I always get the message displayed as We're still setting up your environment. Please try again in about 5 minutes."

Link of Business Data Cloud trial is : https://trials.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com/index.html?page=6

I waited for one whole day and still it shows the same. Has anyone faced similar issue? Any solution for this?

entry.content: starting this week Data Builder missing in datasphere basic trial

entry.title: How to recover missing documents in datasphere replication flow without having to reinitialize
entry.content:
Hi 

I was wondering if it is possible to recover missing documents when replicating data from SAP ECC to SAP datasphere via SLT without having to do initial load again. I was informed that some accounting documents were missing for certain days.  Upon investigation, I found that the missing documents wasn't transferred due to error message "Transferring delta data failed due to the following error: An exception was raised / System failure." 

We are running the replication flow every minute so it will be hard to see the error if it happens and we want  to avoid doing initial load every time to fix it.

Thanks,

B

entry.title: Integrating SAP ECC with Snowflake using SAP Datasphere as a pass-through
entry.content:
Hi Experts, 

We have a requirement to use SAP Datasphere as a pass-through layer for integrating SAP ECC data into Snowflake, and we are seeking help and guidance from the community/SAP experts.

Details are below,

Landscape

  • Source: SAP ECC 6.0 EHP7 (Oracle DB)

  • Target: Snowflake

  • Middleware: SAP Datasphere (as pass-through, since tenant isn’t available in UAE region)

  • License: SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) already procured

Requirement

  • Leverage existing ECC extractors to ingest ECC data into Snowflake through Datasphere.

Approaches identified

  1. ABAP Connection + DMIS add-on → Enable ODP extractors & Replication Flows → Datasphere → ADLS → Snowflake

  2. ECC Connection exposing ODP extractors via Remote Tables → Datasphere → Azure Data Factory → ADLS → Snowflake

Open Questions 

  1. Can BW Bridge be used only as pass-through (without staging) to expose ECC data directly to Snowflake?

  2. Any recommendations or best practices to expose ECC 6.0 EHP7 (Oracle DB) data to 3rd-party applications like Snowflake?

  3. Do you foresee any challenges or limitations with the above proposed solutions?

Looking forward to inputs from SAP and community experts who have dealt with similar SAP-to-Snowflake integration scenarios.

entry.title: Starting Process chains in BW Bridge from Datasphere Taskchains CSRF issue
entry.content:
Hi all,

As mentioned above we would like to start process in our BW Bridge using Datasphere taskchains. We followed the steps in following help page and note

Help page: Configure OpenID Authentication in SAP BW Bridge | SAP Help Portal

Note: 3536298 - Usage of SAP BW Bridge OIDC Configuration in SAP Datasphere Task Chains and Catalog Metadata Extraction - SAP for Me

We are able to add out process chains to task chains now, however the actual run keeps failing with following error: 

However, we found no further information on how to solve this issue, has anyone encountered this before? 



SAP Datasphere

entry.title: how do do delete overlapping month in Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi, 

we would like to load monthly data, and would like to do similar task as delete overlapping request in BW process chain, but couldn't see this option in Datasphere. Is there any way to upload monthly data (including record deletions as well ) daily to Datasphere and clear the same data loaded on previous days.

Thanks

entry.title: How to Pivot/Unpivot Tables in Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello everyone, 

we are porting some T-SQL (MS SQL) code to Datasphere and we need to reimplement a view containing a Pivot/Unpivot query.

I do not see the graphical component for this operation available in Data Builder / Graphical View, Data Flow, Transformation Flow.

Any advice on where to look? Is it only possible through the textual SQL (if at all)? In the official documentation, I could not find anything.

Thanks!

entry.title: sap datasphere: Data Flow vs Transformation Flow
entry.content:
Hi,
 
Can anyone give some use cases or example as to when we should use Data Flow or Transformation Flow?
It is pretty similar to one another, both can transform data from source to target, with lookup/join to populate additional new column or field.
 
Thank you in advance.

entry.title: SAP Datasphere Error during package import
entry.content:
Hello experts,

for our SAP Datasphere system we use export/import packages as a tool to transport changes from DEV system to PROD. We've already deployed some objects in PROD system. Now we need to transport some changes from DEV to PROD.And during package's import we have faced the error like "VIEW_NAME#USNAM can't be deleted because it's currently used by VIEW_NAME_2".  Both views are in this import package, "Dependency Included" mark is set, and both views are from the same space and . Package's option "Overwrite Preferences" was "Overwrite objects and data", and checkbox "Deploy after import" was selected. 

So, I have 2 questions:

  1. Is #USNAM part is somehow meaningful? Because technical name of view doesn't contain that. Or it's just some internal system, stuff?

  2. I don't understand what to do in this case because import package has both objects, so why system didn't overwrite it? Did I miss something?
    Also in the same package we faced same issue, but that was a pair of a local table and replication flow, and to resolve that issue we have deleted RF from PROD system (anyway we had it in the same package), but it isn't looking as a correct way

UPD. VIEW_NAME#USNAM meaned that it was a field USNAM which is deleted from view, but still used by VIEW_NAME_2.

Still don't understand why it didn't overwrite the object if dependent view was also in that package?

entry.title: replication stuck - how to remove scheduled replication
entry.content:
Hi,

I have stopped a replication flow and I am unable to remove it in LTRC. I cannot use stop button either and I have tried using report IUUC_REPL_RESET_OBJECT but it didn't help either.

I have tried several tables and created new Mass transfer Id but the result is same.

How do I remove it from LTRC so that it can continue to replicate the table.

thanks

entry.title: Importing Remote Tables to SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I've set up a SAP HANA (Cloud) connection within Datasphere in order to import remote tables. The connection is valid, Data flows are enabled, Replication flows are enabled and Remote tables are enabled.

I am able to access the schemas, import the remote tables from my HANA data base and I see all the right columns within the Data Builder. When I want to view the data in the Data Viewer I get the message 'No data' in all my imported remote tables, even though there is data available in the respective source system (HANA).

I've attached a screenshot of the message for reference.

Does anyone have a clue what the issue around this might be?

Best,

Kaleab

entry.title: Incorrect URL in code for mission Leverage SAP Ariba data model in SAP Datasphere
entry.content: The URL for extractSupplierRiskData is "/risk-exposure/v1/prod/suppliers/{smVendorId}/exposures" however the active verion for this API is v2. How to change the version in btp application?

entry.title: Replication Flow with ABAP Connection and ODP/SAPI 0FI_AR_4 – Handling Large Volumes
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

we are planning to use in SAP Datasphere a Replication Flow based on an ABAP connection leveraging the ODP/SAPI extractor 0FI_AR_4.
The context is as follows:

  • The data volume is very large (over 2 billion records).
  • We would like to retrieve historical data from an old BW system.
  • The goal is to perform some kind of initialization without transferring data from S/4, and then manage only the deltas.
  • We cannot use a Replication Flow init+delta directly from S/4HANA, because the 0FI_AR_4 extractor without filters is too slow (we estimated about 20 days of extraction) and, based on our tests, it runs into memory errors.
  • We have also noticed that the “Delta Only” option in Replication Flow does not seem to be applicable to our scenario.

    thanks.

entry.title: NDC Converter 2.0: Automating Your Journey from BusinessObjects to Cloud Analytics
entry.content:
SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) provides a unified platform for data ingestion, semantic modeling, governance and analytics. For teams migrating from SAP BusinessObjects (BO), BDC enables:

  • A governed semantic layer in SAP Datasphere that faithfully reproduces and extends your existing BO universes with standardized naming conventions, hierarchies and calculated measures.
  • Cloud-native analytics in SAC for reporting, planning and predictive scenarios, powered by either live data connections or scheduled replication jobs.
  • A clear modernization path for SAP BW/4HANA artifacts and non-SAP sources, preserving embedded business logic while consolidating disparate models.

By porting Web Intelligence (WebI) content into BDC, you can retire legacy BO infrastructure and establish a sustainable foundation built on remote or replicated tables, graphical and SQL views and published semantic models that are fully consumable in SAC.

 

In this follow-up to our NDC Converter introduction, we’ll showcase its newest capabilities and zoom in on how REST APIs, RPA and the SAP BDC stack work together to fully automate your migration workflow and eliminate uncertainty that is often associated with these sorts of projects.

Analysis & clean-up

Migration kicks off with a thorough source analysis powered by our enhanced scanning engine. After installing a lightweight Windows executable in your environment, NDC Converter uses the BusinessObjects REST API to perform a repository-wide scan - cataloging WebI documents, variables, filters and data sources. Parallel processing enables multiple report structures to be inventoried simultaneously, cutting traditional analysis times from days to hours.

If BO access is restricted, you can export a full content catalog instead and NDC Converter will generate a self-service metadata report for rapid sizing and compliance checks. These automated scans deliver hard metrics on:

  • Volume: total reports, pages, charts and objects
  • Complexity: calculations, variables, dimensions and interactive features
  • Usage: inactive or overlapping content

Armed with this detailed data, we can scope migration efforts accurately within days rather than weeks, giving prospects immediate insight into their BI landscape without manual, time-consuming analysis.

Automated report migration

Once WebI queries are identified, the next step is to align them with target system (usually SAP Datasphere but other options available too – for reference see previous blog post). Steps here include:

  • Linking each WebI query to its target system
  • Generating the necessary migration definitions
  • Automatically provisioning and deploying the corresponding tables

If you’re working with many tables, the “mass deploy” feature lets you push them live in bulk—no tedious one-by-one clicks.

After tables are deployed, we configure on-demand or scheduled data replication to maintain synchronization between target and source systems, followed by creating graphical and SQL-based views to implement calculation logic. The final step is to publish these views to SAP Analytics Cloud where up-to-date data can be accessed.

The data source layer migration involves analyzing the BO repository, migrating universe metadata and/or transitioning live models based on BEx queries. Upon completion of the initial data migration, a comprehensive semantic model is introduced that mirrors your original WebI structures including dimensions, measures, hierarchies and data. This transformation provides a cloud-ready foundation for all SAP Analytics Cloud initiatives.

NDC Converter 2.0

With your semantic model live, we proceed with WebI reports migration into SAP Analytics Cloud as interactive stories with new high functional coverage. NDC Converter retrieves each report’s layout, structures, tables, charts, filters and visual elements via the BusinessObjects REST API. A blueprint compatible with RPA processing is produced, covering:

  • Layout & structure: multi‑page documents, IDs, descriptions, pages/tabs.
  • Tables & crosstabs: calculated and restricted measures, variables and common WebI calculations.
  • Charts: Bar/Column, Line, Numeric Point, Pie, Donut, Heat Map, Tree Map, Bubble, Scatterplot.
  • Formatting & UX: predefined template stories, titles, text, headers/footers, icons.
  • Filters & interactivity: input controls, query filters, single object filters, drill, hyperlinks.

The RPA bot, delivered as a Chrome extension, reads this blueprint and automates the reconstruction of each report in SAC Story 2.0, preserving original tables, crosstabs, charts, parameters and filters. The resulting SAC Stories mirror your WebI reports while leveraging cloud-native data models.

What stays manual (and why)

NDC Converter automates routine migration tasks, allowing your team to focus on strategic design and governance – here are cases where automation does not bring added value:

  • Data model (business semantics) design: turning technical structures into robust semantic layer requires continuous alignment on reporting vision.
  • Edge cases & redesign: in situations where 1:1 replication isn’t optimal, we propose a workaround solution to comply with business and technical needs.
  • Environment setup: Migrating users, roles and platform configurations using a mix of guided best practices and selective automation.

Collaborate end-end delivery

NDC Converter is an ideal tool for complex migration scenarios, automating the transfer of every structural element—from metadata and queries to filters and visual object definitions. Once the converter has recreated the report skeletons in SAC, your BI team can take over the final steps: refining layouts, adjusting chart properties and validating calculation logic. This collaborative workflow ensures that the most time-consuming technical migrations are handled automatically, while you retain full control over presentation, branding and business requirements.
